accelerated.title: CraftOS-PC Accelerated
accelerated.description: CraftOS-PC Accelerated is a fork of CraftOS-PC using the LuaJIT engine.

api-reference.title: API Reference
api-reference.description: This page lists quick information about all of the new functions in CraftOS-PC.

autoupdate.title: Auto-Updater
autoupdate.description: CraftOS-PC's auto-updater ensures you're always using the latest version of CraftOS-PC.

ccemux.title: Migrating from CCEmuX
ccemux.description: How to move over your files and settings from CCEmuX, as well as compatibility information.

cctweaked.title: CC: Tweaked Features
cctweaked.description: CraftOS-PC supports full emulation of CC: Tweaked, the continuation of the original ComputerCraft.

changelog.title: Changelog
changelog.description: This page lists the changes that were made in each CraftOS-PC version.

cli.title: Command Line Flags
cli.description: CraftOS-PC supports passing a number of options on the command line.

config.title: ComputerCraft Configuration
config.description: CraftOS-PC has a number of options in the configuration to tweak how it works.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: How you can contact the creator of CraftOS-PC.

debugger.title: Debugger
debugger.description: CraftOS-PC v2.2 introduces a debugger for finding bugs in your program.

error-messages.title: Error Messages
error-messages.description: A list of various error messages that may appear, and what they mean.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: How to get started with CraftOS-PC.

gfxmode.title: Graphics Mode
gfxmode.description: CraftOS-PC features an exclusive graphics mode, allowing you to draw pixels with up to 256 colors.

http-server.title: HTTP Server
http-server.description: CraftOS-PC includes the ability to host an HTTP or WebSocket server.

mounter.title: File System Mounting
mounter.description: CraftOS-PC supports mounting real directories inside the virtual computer.

multicomp.title: Multiple Computers
multicomp.description: CraftOS-PC allows you to run multiple computers in parallel.

online.title: CraftOS-PC Online
online.description: CraftOS-PC Online is a full ComputerCraft IDE available online - no downloads required.

periphemu.title: Peripheral Emulation
periphemu.description: CraftOS-PC allows you to emulate all peripherals that are supported in ComputerCraft.

plugins.title: Plugin System
plugins.description: CraftOS-PC supports a plugin system that allows loading custom APIs, peripherals, and Lua libraries.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: This page describes how CraftOS-PC may use your data.

rawmode.title: Raw Mode
rawmode.description: CraftOS-PC v2.3 adds a new renderer that sends the terminal data in a special binary format.

renderers.title: Rendering Options
renderers.description: CraftOS-PC has multiple renderers that can be used to show the terminal using different methods.

saves.title: Save Data Structure & Location
saves.description: This page lists where the different files for CraftOS-PC are located on your hard drive.

screenshot.title: Screenshots & Recording
screenshot.description: CraftOS-PC allows you to quickly take screenshots and record GIFs of your screen.

standalone.title: Standalone Executable
standalone.description: The standalone version of CraftOS-PC can be used when a full installation is not desirable.

standards.title: Standards Mode
standards.description: Standards mode enhances compatibility by changing some behaviors to be more compliant at the expense of performance.
